intro: Munroa mendocina, commonly known as the Mendocino mallow, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Munroa mendocina is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
